info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 31 at 1:59PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN TUCKER AND SOUTHERN PRESTON COUNTIES THROUGH 230 PM EDT... At 159 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles southwest of Rowlesburg, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Terra Alta, Rowlesburg, Tunnelton, Hannahsville, Elgon, Pifer Moutain, Silver Lake, Aurora, Fellowsville, Israel, Saint George, and Cathedral State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
